verses.plain: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

tokens.t: The wicked flee when no man pursueth: but the righteous are bold as a lion.

verses.plain: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof shall be prolonged.

tokens.t: For the transgression of a land many
the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding
knowledge the state
shall be prolonged.

verses.plain: A poor man that oppresseth the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

tokens.t: A poor man that oppresseth the poor
a sweeping rain which leaveth no food.

verses.plain: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

tokens.t: They that forsake the law praise the wicked: but such as keep the law contend with them.

verses.plain: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the LORD understand all things.

tokens.t: Evil men understand not judgment: but they that seek the
understand all

verses.plain: Better is the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than he that is perverse in his ways, though he be rich.

tokens.t: Better
the poor that walketh in his uprightness, than
perverse
ways, though he
rich.

verses.plain: Whoso keepeth the law is a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous men shameth his father.

tokens.t: Whoso keepeth the law
a wise son: but he that is a companion of riotous
shameth his father.

verses.plain: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

tokens.t: He that by usury and unjust gain increaseth his substance, he shall gather it for him that will pity the poor.

verses.plain: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer shall be abomination.

tokens.t: He that turneth away his ear from hearing the law, even his prayer
abomination.

verses.plain: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good things in possession.

tokens.t: Whoso causeth the righteous to go astray in an evil way, he shall fall himself into his own pit: but the upright shall have good
in possession.

verses.plain: The rich man is wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

tokens.t: The rich man
wise in his own conceit; but the poor that hath understanding searcheth him out.

verses.plain: When righteous men do rejoice, there is great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

tokens.t: When righteous
do rejoice,
great glory: but when the wicked rise, a man is hidden.

verses.plain: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh them shall have mercy.

tokens.t: He that covereth his sins shall not prosper: but whoso confesseth and forsaketh
shall have mercy.

verses.plain: Happy is the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.

tokens.t: Happy
the man that feareth alway: but he that hardeneth his heart shall fall into mischief.

verses.plain: As a roaring lion, and a ranging bear; so is a wicked ruler over the poor people.

tokens.t: a roaring lion, and a ranging bear;
a wicked ruler over the poor people.

verses.plain: The prince that wanteth understanding is also a great oppressor: but he that hateth covetousness shall prolong his days.

tokens.t: The prince that wanteth understanding
also a great oppressor:
he that hateth covetousness shall prolong
days.

verses.plain: A man that doeth violence to the blood of any person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

tokens.t: A man that doeth violence to the blood of
person shall flee to the pit; let no man stay him.

verses.plain: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but he that is perverse in his ways shall fall at once.

tokens.t: Whoso walketh uprightly shall be saved: but
perverse
ways shall fall at once.

verses.plain: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain persons shall have poverty enough.

tokens.t: He that tilleth his land shall have plenty of bread: but he that followeth after vain
shall have poverty enough.

verses.plain: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

tokens.t: A faithful man shall abound with blessings: but he that maketh haste to be rich shall not be innocent.

verses.plain: To have respect of persons is not good: for for a piece of bread that man will transgress.

tokens.t: To have respect of persons
not good: for for a piece of bread
man will transgress.

verses.plain: He that hasteth to be rich hath an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

tokens.t: He that hasteth to be rich
an evil eye, and considereth not that poverty shall come upon him.

verses.plain: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

tokens.t: He that rebuketh a man afterwards shall find more favour than he that flattereth with the tongue.

verses.plain: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith, It is no transgression; the same is the companion of a destroyer.

tokens.t: Whoso robbeth his father or his mother, and saith,
no transgression; the same
the companion of a destroyer.

verses.plain: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the LORD shall be made fat.

tokens.t: He that is of a proud heart stirreth up strife: but he that putteth his trust in the
shall be made fat.

verses.plain: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

tokens.t: He that trusteth in his own heart is a fool: but whoso walketh wisely, he shall be delivered.

verses.plain: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

tokens.t: He that giveth unto the poor shall not lack: but he that hideth his eyes shall have many a curse.

verses.plain: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.

tokens.t: When the wicked rise, men hide themselves: but when they perish, the righteous increase.

footnotes.text: by…: or, by men of understanding and wisdom shall they likewise be prolonged
is a companion…: or, feedeth gluttons
hasteth…: or, hath and evil eye hasteth to be rich
a destroyer: Heb. a man destroying
